oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-07-04 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from July 4, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys (including Howdy Forrester, June Webb, Bashful Brother Oswald, Jimmy Riddle, Pap, and Shot Jackson), guest performer Billy Grammer, and regular performers Archie Campbell, the Jordanaires, and June Carter. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1030th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Archie Campbell; Billy Grammer; Jordanaires; Howdy Forrester; June Webb
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff and Grant Turner introduce Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff and Grant Turner introduce Billy Grammer -- Gotta Travel On (Billy Grammer, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Grant Turner introduces Howdy Forrester -- Liberty (Howdy Forrester) -- Grant Turner introduces June Webb -- You Take The Table (And I'll Take The Chairs) (June Webb) -- Roy Acuff introduces the Jug Band
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Jordanaires (Musical group); Campbell, Archie; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Bashful Brother Oswald; Webb, June, 1934-; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Jackson, Shot; Grammer, Billy
